review_blob: I am genuinely shocked and saddened by the ratings of this beer. This is what the Younger was, when the Younger was the Younger. Amazingly hoppy, to the point of excess. A glass of resin from a pine tree. A fuzzy bomb. I kept waiting for the beer to become undrinkable as it warmed, and it never did. The flavors warmed and blended. I reveled in the complexity til I drained the foam. This should be a top ten beer.
beer_name: Rip Current OBriens One 20th Anniversary IPA

review_blob: On tap at the brewpub. The menu says 8.5%. Its just a good straightforward double IPA. Its more pine tree and high citrus and less malty and boozy.
How come all these shitty beers have Heineken at the end of their name? Oh, wait, I know. Cus Heineken makes its money off of marketing cheap shitty beers. Heres one more.

Im only doing this for the tick. Had this multiple times at a Thai or Indian restaurant. Its not painful by any measure, its just not there. As I sit here at the computer having the beer, I could argue the merit of having a beer with dinner, or I could argue to have a soda.

It took longer to find this beer in the database than it was worth. Its Hinano, not Hitano. Dont look for "Premium Lager", or Tahiti. Just look for the 428 ratings. Really, that low? Since I have surf trunks with the logo, I thought itd be a bit higher. Id rather smoke a cigarette than finish this beer. It doesnt taste worse than an ashtray or anything, Im just jonesing for a smoke, and this beer is boring. I quit smoking two months ago, so, you know...

Gifted by my buddy Jim, who had just too much beer in his fridge. Pale clear yellow. Nose light and grassy. Blah. Taste is sweet corn and not much more. Doubt Ill finish it. Ive got good beer in the fridge.

Bottle gifted by a buddy with too much beer. Thanks Jim. The best beer is free beer, especially if I feel like rating a couple, and its unrated to me. Totally drinkable. Light caramel and maybe even to a bit of toffee, its so smooth and drinkable. This is not the beer to tell Junior to drink so he hates beer for a few more beers. Junior will say "Thank you Sir, may I have another. Beats a Bud any day.
UPDATED: JUL 26, 2015

On tap at Urge for SD Beer Week. Im so used to VaS being amazing, I set the bar pretty high. Its an amazing beer all by itself, which is why it gets a 4.0. Maybe other batches of this version had more coconut, but I was disappointed with this. Not much on the nose, and none in the mouth. Just plain-old, boring awesome VaS, for the most part.
beer_name: Ballast Point Victory at Sea - Toasted Coconut

review_blob: This is officially my favorite summertime beer ever. If I had a kegerator, this would be in it from May to September. The sharp acidy tartness of the grapefruit pairs perfectly with the citrus character of the hops in this already-amazing brew. Best treatment of a great beer in a long time.

On tap at Urge Gastropubs 53 tap Stone takeover. It was quite a list. Great sweet ans spicy stout. Creamy with milk flavors that blend perfectly with the chai spices. Would be fantastic with a slice of pumpkin pie.

On tap at Urge Gastropubs 53 tap Stone takeover. It was quite a list. Was one of the highlights of the day. Nice sharp spiciness of a saison, matched with the wonderful tartness of the white wine. Very nice mix of flavors.
beer_name: Stone "The Tiger Cub" Saison - White Wine Barrel

review_blob: On tap at Urge Gastropubs 53 tap Stone takeover. It was quite a list. I was a bit disappointed with this one. Not very thick in the glass, nor rich on the palate. Sharp roasty bitterness, without the big rich choclateness or coffee I so want in this.
beer_name: 10 Barrel / Bluejacket / Stone Suede Imperial Porter

review_blob: On tap at Urge Gastropubs 53 tap Stone takeover. It was quite a list. Great maltiness with a solid sharp kick of Rye/whiskey barrel. Very nice, but a bit light, when following the double bastard barrel aged brew.
beer_name: Arrogant Bastard Ale - Templeton Rye Barrel

review_blob: 1st rating in a long time. Gotta hit the Pannepots! I love these. Sweet and bit of tart. Lightly fizzy with tart bite out back. Love these beers.

Figured Id better put this one down since Ive had it a few times this week. Cheers to Greg and the boys for making this happen. Floral and musky perfume nose, and rosy orange amber. Sharp malt and sweet mid fruit. Well balanced. Nice beer.

On tap at brewery. Bright light pale white amber. Fizzy but dense head. Nose is big sweet Belgian yeast candy. Taste is Belgian burst followed by big lavender sweetness. Combo goes great together. Chick beer. Complex and enjoyable chick beer.
Tasted at brewery. Dark brown with red tints and dark tan big head. Nose is deep tart and lightly smoky malt. Taste is thick and rich. Deep tart hints and chocolate. Gooiness behind.
beer_name: Monkey Paw / AleSmith Ashes from the Grave

review_blob: On tap at Urge in RB/Poway.  Medium black pour with strong Bremen head. Looks nice in the glass. Nose is deep rich with a hint of high milky maltball. Nice.  Taste is rich and smooth and even. Again, maltball. Very nice.

On tap at Urge in RB/Poway.  Thick black pour with remarkably brown head. Nose is strong cocoa roasted malt. Taste is huge dry cocoa and coffee. Not much sweet at all. Creamy with a tart light bite. Long lingering leftovers. Nice.

On tap at Urge in RB/Poway. Thin black pour with quickly fading tan head to not much lace. Nose is sweet dark malt. Taste is dark sweet and coffee, but more sweet. Bit of nuttiness as it moves. Not much in the back. Light like a milk stout should be, I guess.

On tap at Urge in RB/Poway. Nose is milky mint chocolate. Taste is HUGE cocoa and coffee. Gigantic deep rich burst, followed by light refreshing mint. Not overpowering like a mint patty, but smooth clear and clean. Pour is black with revolting thick tan lace assaulting the glass. Lovely.
beer_name: Ken Schmidt / Iron Fist / Stone Mint Chocolate Imperial Stout

review_blob: On tap at Urge in RB/Poway. Deep orange with off white head and lotsa lace.  Nose is light sweet malty with just a hint of ginger. Taste is big strong roasty pale ale immediately, to mango sweet in the middle. Roasty sharp in the end. Big flavor. Nice.

On tap at brewery while picking up BA Speedway. Nose is huge malty boozy rich sweet, like a gigantic barley wine. Chocolate and brown sugar. Taste is same. Not nearly as boozy though. Bit of metallic bite. Pulls saliva like a sour. Long rich sweetness. Really big beer. Good for a cold day.
beer_name: AleSmith Nut Brown Ale - Barrel Aged

beer_brewer_name: Port Brewing Co / The Lost Abbey
review_blob: At the brewery for the Battel Night. Nose sharp dry tart and stone fruit. Taste is same. Sharp dry tart and light pepper. Bite in the back. Dry up front, vinegar back. Nice.
beer_name: Lost Abbey Barrel 43: Gwen Dances at the Copacabana

review_blob: 22 oz bottle from the good man nearbeer, who I met up with on a family trip to Knoxville.  22 oz bottle poured into a Green Flash tulip.  Cloudy brass yellow with effervescent white head.  Head disappears to nothing, but quickly comes back with a bit of swirling.  Nose is tart mid citrus sweetness.  Lots of flavors moving around on this one.  Bit of tart, saltiness, vinegar bite, smoke.  My wife says "Tastes like meat!"  Thanks for a great bottle to bring back from an adventure.

Bottle at Stone, after a person with questionable taste returned the bottle, saying it was no good.  "Yer dumb", I say.  Light gold/amber with tiny to no head.  Get the sweetness of a cider, with a chewy woodiness.  Great movement around the mouth.  Much more complex than other ciders Ive had.  Yummy.
On tap at Urge. Honey amber pour with little to no head. Nose is sweet and roasty. Taste is warm apricot to roasty bitter. Really drinkable and full for a pale ale.
On tap at Urge. Cloudy pale white yellow. Nice light citrus like a wit followed by hoppy sharpness. Great light summertime brew.

Been a while since Ive entered a rating, but this is one that I wanted to rate to finish the set.  08 Bottle.  Pour is bilious brown yellow. Color of watery diarrhea.  By that, I man cola brown at the bottom, with golden highlights at the top, with lots of suspended chunks.  Nose is rich sweet malt and alcohol.  Sharp.  Taste is massive sweet sharp warming malt.  Ugly and lovely.  Long lingering leftovers.  Probably feel this one in the morning.
beer_name: Struise Pannept - Old Monks Ale - Pannepeut

review_blob: On tap at the Old Grove location. Golden pale pour with small white head. Nose is a bowl of freshly picked earthy jalapeos. Id say guajillos, but Ive never smelled a fresh bowl of those. The anticipation is one spicy brew. Yep. Taste is exactly the same. Spicy and sharp. Earthy and clean with a lot of pepper bite. Wahoo with Thai chili and lime was not overpowering. This is.
beer_name: Ballast Point Calico Amber Ale - Guajillo Pepper

review_blob: On tap at the Old Grove location.  Cant believe Ive never rated this more common brew. Super unfiltered cloudy pale white/yellow pour with huge sticky white head. Nose is yeasty lemonade. Taste is not as good as nose. Tart odd citrus to not much better. Hints of burnt plastic. Maybe not a good batch.

On tap at the Old Grove location.  Light pale yellow with decent haze. Nose is yeast and lime and Ginger. Up front taste is high tart sweet. Lotsa lime and a good dose of Ginger. Clean and bright. High fresh chili pepper bite comes in late and stays to party after the beer is long gone. Not overpowering or off-putting, but obvious. Nice beer.
beer_name: Ballast Point Wahoo White - Thai Chili

review_blob: On tap at Urge. Had to let it warm a bit before I felt I could give it a taste. Nose is maple syrup, malt, and sharp booze. Taste is huge. Big fuzzy vanilla and sharp boozy malt. Long lingering warmth and lasting bitterness. Seems like something that would do great for a year or three in the beer closet. Really nice and big.
beer_name: Hangar 24 Barrel Roll No. 04: Hammerhead - Barrel Aged Barley Wine

review_blob: On tap at urge. 1 of 8 on tap. Dark red-brown with mocha petri head. Nose light sweet of dark fruit and smooth malt. Taste is high and quick. Light compared to curmudgeon. Sharp dark malty tart. Clean quick finish. Bit of roastiness out back, buit not for long.

On tap at Urge. 1 of 8 on tap. Dark orange w dense light-tan head. Nose deep rich sweet. Taste is big boom of creamy sweet and hints of tart. Big full fuzzy mouthful. Ring and lace destroy glass. Alcohol bite to vanilla and oak. Very nice.

I didnt add it, but Im the first to rate it. Obriens had a number of his tribute beers on tap, and this was one of them. 100 pct of all money was donated to his family. Dark red brown pour with thick big dense tan head. Nose is lightly sugar sweet malty with green grape hints. Taste moves around a lot. Copper penny and bloody sweet is first. Bit of metallic sharp. Tart prune, lightly, to fuzzy dry yeasty back. Sweet alcohol. Gooey throat.

On tap at OBriens. Dark brown to black pour with red brown highlights and solid tan head. Nose is tons of rich chocolate and almost a hint of peanut butter. Taste is big rich sweet up front to coffee bitter in the middle. Round and full in the mouth with a sharp sweet malt bite in the back. Nuts and coffee and cocoa.

This was a special gift of an Irish buddy returning from a visit with his friend who is a brewer in Scotland. Enjoyed at a drunken adult prom party. Moderately dark with bed brown tints. Nose is sweet malt with hints of cherry tart. Booze and vanilla and tart. Taste is big sweet malty tart with light fuzzy booze and dark fruit. Yeast and coffee and vanilla and fuzzy booze. Dont understand the low ratings. Really really good brew.

This was a special gift of an Irish buddy returning from a visit with his friend who is a brewer in Scotland. This was shared at a drunken adult prom party. Absolutely beautiful. Black pour with no highlights. Nose is remarkably complex with deep roast malt, brown sugar alcohol, roses and oak. Stunning nose. Taste is exactly the same with sweet oaky booze. Vanilla and cherries and oak. Absolutely lovely.

Shared at the Mikes. Brown pour with bright red highlights. Nose is chocolate and malt with tart hints. Most distinct movement of any beer I can easily remember. Big sharp roast to sweet tart pear to distinct Hershey chocolate syrup to tart funkiness. Like changing channels on the TV. great beer from an infection.
beer_name: Dark Horse King Of The Forest

review_blob: Some days just keep getting better. Bright hazy ruby. Instantly disappearing head to lace that is gone just as quickly. Nose tart vinegar and subtle spice. Mouth is dusty dry. Light tart and musty and lovely. Sandpaper and dust leftovers. Beautifully understated and complex.

Again with deftim13 busting out the goodness. Rich ruby and blood pour. No head at all but bubbles along the side of the glass. Tart sharp dark cherry/raspberry/rhubarb pie. Taste clean and sharp. Cinnamon and cherries. Nice pucker finish.

Deftim13 is insane. This starts massively sharp with booze and oak. Sharp alcohol continues but fuzzy vanilla and cream grow. Big mouth feel and coating. Hints of bandaid and medicine, but not in a bad way. Unfortunate to open a rare directly after, but before I finished this rate.
Bomber traded by Dak I think. Nose has bit of oxidation, then cherries and fuzzy warm alcohol. Big rich tart sweet and long dark smooth. Bits of coffee and vanilla and dark fruit. Very nice.
beer_name: Foothills / Duck-Rabbit / Olde Hickory Olde Rabbits Foot

review_blob: Another beauty by deftim13 shared at the Mikes. Hazy light orange amber with tiny head to scant lace. Warm sweet tart on the nose. Smooth. Big round fruity with just a bit of tartness. Opposite of sharp and dry. Round and wet in mouth. Tartness increases with warmth. Very little carbonation. Long lingering tart apple back. Nice.
375 bottle from Tim B shared at mikes. Super bright lively tart yeasty nose. Bright hazy light amber. Super crunchy tart. Dusty dry finish with sharp tart smack. Great.

On tap at brewery. Black pour with almost no head. Strong roast malt in the mouth overpowers the vanilla. Vanilla tones down the nose quite a bit compared to other versions. Smoother in mouth than others too.

On tap at Hamiltons. Hazy dark orange amber with tiny head and no lace. Nose is high tart light sweetness and flat yeast smack. Hints of cinnamon and cherry. Taste up front is nice tart sweet funkiness with bit of yeasty bite. As it moves in the mouth the flavor drops significantly in quality. Goes kinda odd. Not exactly petroleum but not far away from it. Gooey, and not specifically in a good way. Kinda burnt. Not a drainpour by any measure, but disappointing based upon initial expectations.

On tap at Hamiltons. This puts me into the top 5 of Lagunitas brews for the moment. Bright light amber with strong white head. Nose all hops with hint of Lagunitas tart wildness. Bit of white pepper.  Taste same. Lotsa hoppiness and hint of wildness. Really good iipa, and if you know the brewery you know the beer. No hint of the 9.2 abv.
